name: indefeasible
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be cancelled or officially announced to not exist: indefeasible right The rule protects tenants' indefeasible right of personal security from unlawful searches. Where the right has been enjoyed for 40 years, it is to be considered absolute and indefeasible.
More examplesFewer examplesThese are personal and private liberties that we all believe to be absolutely indefeasible. They regarded the cross-examination of witnesses as the indefeasible right of each party.The registered owner's indefeasible title was protected against trespassers.
